intro: Montiopsis copiapina, commonly known as the Copiapó montiopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Atacama Desert in Chile. It is a low-growing, perennial herb with small, fleshy leaves adapted to arid conditions. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale blue flowers during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water due to its desert origin. Montiopsis copiapina is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in harsh environments.
